intro: Coccoloba virens, commonly known as the Emerald Coast or Green Island plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in coastal and tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are typically heart-shaped or ovate in form. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. Coccoloba virens is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
